rows.STUDIO 4 TAXONOMY: Definitions of proprietary concepts — a shared vocabulary for how we operate

rows.col_2: Definition
A complete operational blueprint that makes a business runnable by anyone. Not a plan — a system.
A unit of operational knowledge that didn't exist before, codified in reusable format. IP in spreadsheet form.
Deliberate design of starting parameters to maximize probability of downstream success. Most leverage is here.
rows.col_3: Building the ODD before hiring the Operator

rows.col_2: Hiring people to hire people. Adding abstraction layers to multiply founder leverage.
Stacking 3+ alignment mechanisms so coordination survives single-point failures.
rows.col_3: Equity + bonuses + CM monitoring + escalation triggers

rows.col_2: Measuring product-market fit with data signals, not intuition. PMF as information integration.
Designing the role before finding the person. Separating role failure from talent failure.
rows.col_3: Operator Scorecard defines the role; then we find who fits

rows.col_2: Fiduciary-grade oversight for portfolio ventures. Higher than advisor, different than board.
rows.col_3: CM reports to Trustee on compliance grades

rows.col_2: Accumulated misalignment that compounds over time. Like tech debt, but for people/process.
rows.col_3: Unclear decision authority that causes repeated conflicts

rows.col_2: A single venture within the Trade holding structure. One business, one P&L, one operator.
rows.col_3: IonWave is a TUP within Studio 4

rows.col_2: Definition
Launch readiness milestone. Site live, product ready, ads ready to run.
First real traction. 100 customers acquired with CAC under control.
Product-market fit signals confirmed. Repeatable acquisition, positive unit economics.
Initial 12-week execution phase. High intensity, daily accountability.
Role responsible for daily standards enforcement across operators.
Predefined condition that automatically escalates to next authority level.
rows.col_3: Grade drops to CCC → escalate to Studio

rows.col_2: Document specifying who can decide what, at what thresholds.
rows.col_3: Operator can spend up to $500 without approval

rows.col_2: Qualitative grade for brand/creative quality. Separate from performance metrics.
rows.col_3: A+ = exceptional, B = acceptable, C = needs work

rows.col_2: Definition
A single spreadsheet sheet containing one topic/process/framework.
Logical grouping of related tabs.
Meta-navigation tab showing where to find things across the model.
Role-specific list of tabs to read and setup tasks to complete.
The master onboarding document combining all role packets.

Designing the role before finding the person. Seven dimensions: Delegation Depth, Decision Authority, Performance Surface, Compensation Architecture, Interface Map, Fidelity Mechanisms, Escalation Architecture. Separates role failure from talent failure.
rows.col_3: Operator role engineered across all 7 dimensions before JD written

rows.col_2: Organizational frame where the company runs as a school. 6 programs, 12-week semesters, curricula of TUPs, grades for programs and individuals. Dean = Operator, Registrar = CoS, Accreditation = CM.
rows.col_3: IonWave Semester 1: Acquisition + Conversion focus, midterm review at Week 6

rows.col_2: One of 6 functional areas (Acquisition, Conversion, Retention, Product, Operations, Finance). Each has a dean, a curriculum, and semester grades.
rows.col_3: Acquisition Program: VSL TUP, Hook Testing, Ad Scaling

rows.col_2: 12-week time-boxed execution period. Enrollment → Execution → Midterm → Execution → Finals → Grades.
rows.col_3: Semester 1 = Genesis: Table Set → First Blood

rows.col_2: When a business can run independently. Trade Grade A sustained 2 semesters. Revenue, profitability, team, systems all at threshold.
rows.col_3: IonWave graduates when $100K MRR, positive margin, Operator independent for full semester
